title: My Gripe against Dragon!!!!
body:
As a jungler main I have noticed something and I'm not sure other people have noticed yet....

The first dragon buff (+8% damage) is too damn good for it to be soo damn dependent on bottom lane to be A) responsive and B) winning lane.

I think its always been the case that bottom lane was super important for securing dragon but this buff really changes up the game alot. Top lane really doesnt have any say for Baron control so Baron is whatever.... but Dragon is so snowball-y that it can really change up the game. If you have a stronger bottom lane.... you can get the early dragon and get an advantage across all lanes. Think about every time your top and they get away with that sliver of health.

Mayb swtich the dragon buff orders???

replies.body:
http://www.surrenderat20.net/p/current-pbe-balance-changes.html

"Dragon Slayer Buff

The Dragon Slayer buff has received a few changes
Dragon's Might has been reduced to 6% from 8%
+15% damage to towers and buildings is now granted at  two stacks instead of four. 
 +15% damage to minions and monsters is now granted at four stacks instead of two."

I started checking SurrenderAt20 for PBE notes and it is nice to know what is quite possible :D

The dragon changes doesnt really fix the issue tbh....
15% against minions for the first one makes more sense, then movement speed, then 15% tower damage, THAN 6% damage increase. 

ORRRR just make all the buffs randomise...
I agree that it doesn't really fix the issue. However, those notes are subject to change and it tells us Riot is working on it.

Tbh it will be better if Baron and Dragon both give buffs but are of different uses (for example one is more stats like damage and the other is more utility like MS of cdr) and prob both are stackable (Baron buff will not be the late game steroid in this case), and they both spawn at the same time, whenever it may be.

And the location of Baron and Drag spawn can swap from game to game. Or prob not depending on your point of view.

This encourages a flexible and healthy meta because different team comp will have a different focus, they will try to focus and take down either Baron or Dragon to enhance their particular team strength.

Just foods for thought.

Dragon is the new baron, don't ya know.

But yeah the stack power of dragon is just too amazing, I think maybe utility buffs like speed should come at first stack, not +6% damage
That attack bonus really multiplies out too with more items and levels.... arrrgh

Play Pantheon take dragon at level 1.
Then proceed to run around the map like a %%%% throwing spears at Rav.
